title: Value of a function defined as a power series

content.question: The Maclaurin series for the function f is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mi>n</mi> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A46@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C6B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

topic.text: 10.15: (BC ONLY) Representing Functions as Power Series

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
